item.text: After Abimelech’s death, Tola son of Puah, grandson of Dodo, from the tribe of Issachar, rose up to deliver Israel. He lived in Shamir in the Ephraimite hill country.
He led Israel for 23 years, then died and was buried in Shamir.
Jair the Gileadite rose up after him; he led Israel for 22 years.

He <st data-num="01961" class="">had</st> <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> who <st data-num="07392" class="">rode</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="05895" class="">donkeys</st> and <st data-num="01992" class="">possessed</st> <st data-num="07970" class="">30</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st>. <st data-num="05704" class="">To</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">these</st> towns are <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="02334" class="">Havvoth Jair</st><n id="1" />—<st data-num="0834" class="">they</st> are in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>.<n id="2" />
Jair died and was buried in Kamon.

The Israelites again did evil in the Lord’s sight. They worshiped the Baals and the Ashtoreths, as well as the gods of Syria, Sidon, Moab, the Ammonites, and the Philistines. They abandoned the Lord and did not worship him.
The Lord was furious with Israel and turned them over to the Philistines and Ammonites.

They <st data-num="07492" class="">ruthlessly</st> <st data-num="07533" class="">oppressed</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="08083 06240">eighteenth</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st><n id="2" />—that is, <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">living</st> <st data-num="05676" class="">east</st> of the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st> in <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorite</st> <st data-num="0776 0834">country</st> in <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>.
The Ammonites crossed the Jordan to fight with Judah, Benjamin, and Ephraim. Israel suffered greatly.
The Israelites cried out for help to the Lord: “We have sinned against you. We abandoned our God and worshiped the Baals.”
The Lord said to the Israelites, “Did I not deliver you from Egypt, the Amorites, the Ammonites, the Philistines,

the <st data-num="06722" class="">Sidonians</st>, <st data-num="06002" class="">Amalek</st>, and <st data-num="04584" class="">Midian</st><n id="1" /> when they <st data-num="03905" class="">oppressed</st> you?<n id="2" /> You <st data-num="06817" class="">cried out for help</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, and I <st data-num="03467" class="">delivered</st> you from their <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st>.<n id="3" />

But <st data-num="03651" class="">since</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="05800" class="">abandoned</st> me and <st data-num="05647" class="">worshiped</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>, I will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03467" class="">deliver</st> you <st data-num="03254" class="">again</st>.

<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> and <st data-num="02199" class="">cry for help</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0430 0834">gods</st> you have <st data-num="0977" class="">chosen</st>! Let <st data-num="01992" class="">them</st> <st data-num="03467" class="">deliver</st> you <st data-num="06256" class="">from</st> <st data-num="06869" class="">trouble</st>!”<n id="1" />
But the Israelites said to the Lord, “We have sinned. You do to us as you see fit, but deliver us today!”
They threw away the foreign gods they owned and worshiped the Lord. Finally the Lord grew tired of seeing Israel suffer so much.
The Ammonites assembled and camped in Gilead; the Israelites gathered together and camped in Mizpah.
The leaders of Gilead said to one another, “Who is willing to lead the charge against the Ammonites? He will become the leader of all who live in Gilead!”
